channel.title: Need help...Server issue
channel.description:
Ok, I followed this sites tut on making a server. I have no-ip,moparscape downloaded,and i downloaded testscape source. Now when I run moparscape and I click on compile.bat it says "Javac" is not recognized as an internal or external command,operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue...
Please help! thanks

item.title: Need help...Server issue
item.dc:creator: @kennyboy93 kennyboy93
item.description:
@kennyboy93 wrote:

[quote=“DAWIGG, post:5, topic:16321”]goto control panel > system > advanced (tab) > evironmental variables
and make sure there is a thing under user variables with:
variable: “CLASSpath”
value : CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

without the quotes, of course
and if its not there, then put it there

edit:: press add and add this.[/quote]

my one is easier and works just the same

Read full topic

item.title: Need help...Server issue
item.dc:creator: @DAWIGG DAWIGG
item.description:
@DAWIGG wrote:

goto control panel > system > advanced (tab) > evironmental variables
and make sure there is a thing under user variables with:
variable: “CLASSpath”
value : CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

without the quotes, of course
and if its not there, then put it there

edit:: press add and add this.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help...Server issue
item.dc:creator: @kennyboy93 kennyboy93
item.description:
@kennyboy93 wrote:

goto control panel > system > advanced (tab) > evironmental variables
and make sure there is a thing under user variables with:
variable: “Path”
value : “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_\bin”

without the quotes, of course
and if its not there, then put it there

Read full topic
